intro: Elaphoglossum cruzense, commonly known as the Cruzense holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, pinnately compound fronds with a serrated margin, and its spores are produced on the underside of the leaves. It is often found in dense forests, where it contributes to the undergrowth vegetation. The botanical characteristics of Elaphoglossum cruzense make it a valuable species for studying fern diversity and ecological adaptation.
